reviewText: A blind teen is undergoing an experiment in which she subconsciously taps into the mind of serial killer Ricky Caldwell telepathically to try to awaken him from his comatose state. After another failed attempt, she heads off on vacation over the Christmas holiday, but she inadvertently sends Ricky images of his most hated holiday that awaken him from his mental prison with only one thing on his mind: Revenge? Fearing that there was far too much good celluloid left in the world, Monte Hellman, acclaimed director of nothing, set out to waste as much as possible with another awful sequel to SILENT NIGHT DEADLY NIGHT. Although it is no worse than the last film (no film ever could be), it is certainly less enjoyable. The hilarious overtures of "actor" Eric Freeman are sorely missed here, as Bill Moseley takes over for him in the role. Moseley is only given a couple of lines and forced to wear a ridiculous fishbowl over his exposed brain throughout the entirety of the film, sans Santa suit. The Z-movie plotting immediately falls back into a tedious stalk-and-slash routine with few deaths and very little gore. Avoid.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies
summary: ILHM Reviews Silent Night Deadly Night 3
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen every one of these Silent Night Deadly Night Movies, I have had fun watching them all.Every year at during the Christmas Season is movie night with one of these movies.This is by far the funniest one.This is a follow up to Silent Night part 2.This one is about Ricky,Billy`s(from the first Silent Night)little brother on the loose again.Ricky was shot in the second one from the cops for trying to kill the abusing Mother Supior,for his brothers revenge.This one there is some different guy playing Ricky than on part 2.It is not the same muscular psycho.It seems on this one that he didn`t die at all,but is getting studied for scientific  experiments.He soon escapes the lab,with the doctor or what ever going after him.Their is a blind girl in the movie getting some sort of psychic esp reading of Ricky,knowing who he is.She is traveling with her brother and his girlfrien on the way to grandmas.This is where there is alot of flash backs from the previous two movies.Ricky the killer is of course walking around on the loose with his brain showing,which is pretty hilarious.Soon the doctor and this detective are looking for Ricky,and the doctor has sympathy for poor little ricky.Well I don`t want to spoil the ending.This is a fun movie.Anybody who is in to thw other Silent Night Deadly Night movies will be happy to add this to their collection.Or if a person who is new to the trilogy it is good for a watch.Give it a try.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I absolutely love every chapter in this series (except for part 4) and this is one of the chief reasons why!  In this one, Ricky the Santa Clause killer, goes up against a blind girl with ESP.  There is lots of suspense,  gore, and action here, as well as snappy production values and good acting.  The only complaint I had about this movie by the time it was over was the  fact that Ricky never dresses up as santa.  All of the killer santa we see  in this flick is footage from the previous movies or in a brief (about 2  minutes) dream sequence in which the killer santa does little more than  raise a bloody knife in the air and look scary.  Still a great movie  though, and only second to part 2.  Just for the record, here is a list of  all the SN,DN films in the order of which I like them: 2(the  best),3,5,1,4(the worst).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hey gang!  Guess what time it is?  If you guessed a crappy sequel to a crappy franchise time you get a cookie.  Sadly the cookie will be sprinkled with magnesium and will catch on fire you eat it too fast.  So grab a coco, get your slippers on and find a snuggle buddy.  This is Silent Night Deadly Night Part 3: You Better Watch Out.Spoilers of unusual size?  I don't believe in their existence.Yes two whole years after GARBAGE DAY we the people of movie going must have spoken out telepathically as one saying, "Boy I sure hope another pointless sequel loosely based to a holiday comes soon," and indeed it did.  Note how my let's get me a directing gig or at least 2 of my screenplays sold for an obscene amount of cash has yet to be heard.Taking the helm of this clearly needed film is Director Monte Hellman (The Terror, Flight of Fury, The Shooting, Two-Lane Blacktop, Cockfighter and Road to Nowhere), a former protégé of Roger Corman tackles the issue of umm didn't Ricky die in the last movie due to multiple gunshots and falling through a window?  Well hey kids, we don't have to worry because the director of a classy flick like Cockfighter is on the case.  Ahh that is just a fun title to say isn't it?  One more time for me and then back to the review.  Cockfighter.We open our movie a big honking title card then slowly reveal a young girl into frame, as well as how badly her eyebrows need tweezing.  Seriously it looks like two caterpillars trying to mate. The girl raises from her bed in some dream world (Cue Robert Englund) and she see a man on a hospital bed, tubes going every which way and enough overhead lights to make a soap opera concerned.  The man of course is Ricky (Bill Moseley of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2, Night of the Living Dead remake, Army of Darkness, House of a Thousand Corpses and the Devil's Rejects) with a clear plastic dome on his head showing exposed brain.  Yup I cannot even conjure BS like this.  The eerie music that is supposed to be ratcheting up tension sounds like a test pattern after 2 in the morning on basic cable.  Awake from her dream Laura (Samantha Scully of the Best of the Best and Bloodsuckers)shrieks in true overacting style is calmed by the soothing voice of Dr. West er um Dr. Newbury (Richard Beymer of The Diary of Anne Frank, Westside Story, The Longest Day, Twin Peaks and Profiler) is certain Laura is a latent psychic and can get in Ricky's mind bringing him to consciousness through the aid of stock footage and what would a Silent Night sequel be without stock footage.  No idea what kind of dream study this entitles but hey how the heck is scooping the top of Ricky's head and replacing it with a bolted metal circlet and plastic dome bring a man back from the dead?  Laura is off to the hills to Grandmother's house with her brother Chris (Eric DaRe of Twin Peaks, The Flash, Critters 4 and Ted Bundy) and his girlfriend Jerri (Laura Harring of General Hospital, Sunset Beach, Mulholland Dr. and The Punisher).  A drunken hospital Santa makes a few lewd gestures towards the candy stripers and visits comatose Ricky, belches Thunderbird in his direction, causing Ricky to awaken and gack Santa.  Okay a quick couple of complaints fresh in the mind and afterwards I swear we are done.  Rather than take the traditional Santa suit at the ready, Ricky decides a hospital gown and a clear skull dome straight out of The Outer Limits is the look for hitchhiking.  Being blind and psychic should not allow you to be a total jackhole. While this film and this film's Ricky had more focus on being a nutter butter it was sadder better than the second one but that's like saying Superman III wasn't as bad and Superman IV.  The saddest thing is there are two more sequels after this rotten turkey.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The hideously injured Ricky has been saved. Still deep in a coma, his exposed brain has been encased in a plexiglas cap bolted to his skull. But strange things start to happen when a gifted clairvoyant taps into Ricky's dark and twisted brain waves.Eventhough this film didn't have a bunch of flashbacks, it was still pretty boring. This time Ricky is quiet? Just because he got shot? These sequels keep getting worse and more worse. I've seen all the SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT films up to the third one, and I can tell you, these movies should be trashed. This time it has something to do with Christmas, but there's no snow. I know it can be Christmas without snow in some areas of the U.S. but please add some snow, so it doesn't look like you were in a rush to make this film. I remember the first SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT had snow, but the second one didn't, and neither did this one. These movies are just horrible.I thought it was also weird how he died. He was still alive when he should have been dead. Weird movie if you ask me.There might not be any more flashbacks, but it's still a horrible one to waste your time on. I'd rather watch the first one.I hope my review was helpful to you!
summary: Finally, No More Flashbacks, But A Boring Sequel!

reviewText: I would say this is the worst in the Silent Night series. It has a lame story of Ricky surviving and is now in a coma who encounters a blind girl with E.S.P who can tap into his thoughts. If you think that sounds strange and quite stupid its because it is,this movie is unintentionly funny with the character Ricky wearing what looks to be a bowl of some sort on his head(reminds me of something from the kitchen)and Ricky is played by a different actor from the previous which I thought would be good news since the last Ricky was terrible,but this Ricky is just as bad. This movie is slow-paced and flat out boring. SKIP THIS AND TRY TO GET A COPY OF THE CLASSIC(1984/SILENT NIGHT,DEADLY NIGHT)INSTEAD OF PART 3 WHICH IS NOT EVEN WORTH A FREE RENTAL!
Title: N/A

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Laura (Samantha Scully) is blind and is a bit psychic. In an experiment they hook her up to our Santa killer (Bill Moseley) who is in a coma with his brain exposed under a plexiglass bowl. Psycho gets loose and goes after Laura. Not much to see here.Laura dressed very well for a blind person. Normally sighted people dress them up funny in odd clothes like Stevie Wonder. Samantha Scully with her long dark hair reminded me of Jennifer Connelly. She obvious got the parts Jennifer turned down. She is helped around by her brother Chris (Eric Da Re who went on to be an unnamed medic in "Starship Troopers") and his new girlfriend Jerri (Laura Harring who has gotten better with age).The acting was what you would expect for the third installment of a "B" movie. Like most third installments they tend to stray from the original film, although not as bad as "Halloween 3" but not as good as "Escape from the Planet of the Apes." Unless you are really into bad 80's horror films, you might want to skip this one.PARENTAL GUIDE: Adult language. No sex. Nudity (Laura Harring plus mom from original film)
Title: N/A

reviewText: At the time Monte Hellman did "Silent Night, Deadly Night 3" he was at the lowest point of his career. It seems to me that he was in desperately need of money I have no other explanation why the director of "Two-Lane Blacktop" or "The Shooting" would have accepted to do this brainless and uninspired horrorflick. Although I haven't seen the first two "Silent Nights" (to be honest, I only watched this film because of Mr. Hellman being the director !) this Santa Claus thing is for the pits !
